Reviews.Title: E-mail alerts function does not work!!
Reviews.Author: Robert R. Cox
Reviews.Content: I've just had this system a short time and I can't determine if I like it or not.  True, it's very easy to set up but configuring the software to view online could be a bit tedious if you are not a techie.  You will have to deal with configuring your router/modem as well, to get the right settings.  So be prepared for that.  But what is most shocking is that e-mail alerts does not work.  After days of struggling to get this to work and thinking that I must be doing something wrong, I decided to contact SVAT customer service.  I received a call from one of their support guys who told me point blank that the e-mail function does not work.  In his words "when they tested it in China it worked, but after they were shipped to the US that function never worked".  So I asked about a firmware update, I was told none was forthcoming.  The was a big disappointment for me because I wanted to be alerted.  My blackberry phone is not compatible with the unit, so I can't view my cameras from my phone.  But in the interest of full disclosure, I was relatively happy with it until I learnt that email alerts does not work.  They need to make people aware of this.  I wonder how many other SVAT models are like this.

Reviews.Title: Great Value For What You Pay For
Reviews.Author: Ho Nam "Bacanshishimo"
Reviews.Content: This system in theory is relatively easy to install.  However, climbing up ladders all over the house to wire de cameras was no easy task when you have a large house.  I planted most of my cameras outside.  My home had been burglarized twice.  Since then, we installed an electrified fence where the burglars entered, an alarm system and motion detecting flood lights.  The cameras added a layer of security.  I installed the monitor where all the cameras feed their images and placed it right on top of my TV.  Since I spend most of time time in the family room, this was a convenient place to put it.  Here are the Pros and Cons of this system for those of you considering this product.Pros:Great price, easy to install, made with good materials and components, fantastic night vision, and fast deliveryCons:The elbow where the camera connects to the base that holds it to the wall needs a lot of improvement, I wish they made the cameras wireless (for convenience and security, anyone can easily cut the wires if within reach), the camera wires can only be extended by one additional 60 foot extension cord only, no zoom option for the cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good Product for the Money
Reviews.Author: A. Newbaker
Reviews.Content: This system is for the paranoid on a budget.I installed this system at a business and was trying to figure out where to put the last 2 Cameras.  8 are more than you'd think once you start considering angles you need covered. I was able to have a constant overlap to where you are always on at least 2, usually 3 cameras at once.The installation went smooth, but my dvr was slightly screwy when I fust hooked it up.  None of the buttons on the face would respond.  However, the remote and the mouse (which I recommend you use anyways) worked fine, so I was just going to deal with it.  After 3 days of running cables, going to purchase a lcd tv, and wiring everything I turned it on and was impressed with the quality (night vision especially).  I set up the motion detection so the DVR could hold more.  Set the time and date.  Big Note! Be careful when tightening the set screw for adjustment.  Confirm that the camera is slid as far back on the wall mount as possible, and only tighten as much as will hold.  A previous install with a 4 camera system i did recently I over tightened (easier than you think) and broke the set screw part on the camera.  I used JB Weld and a zip tie to repair it and 4 months later it's still holing strong.Conclusion:  Slowish interface coupled with low end equipment give you a surveillance system on a budget.  You can make out smaller details and night vision is not bad at all.  Overall, this is a good buy for $500

Reviews.Title: Adequate features, questionable design
Reviews.Author: Denise Hughes
Reviews.Content: Cameras:The cameras are decent quality -- pretty much what you'd expect out of a standard definition analog camera. The IR illumination LEDs are sufficient for an indoor area such as a hall or doorway, but do not product enough light for outdoor scenes such as a driveway. The cameras have aluminum casings rather than plastic which was a pleasant surprise. The provided video cables are a bit thin and may incur interference. They are comprised of a bundled video lead which is terminated with BNC connectors and power leads which terminate with common coaxial DC power connectors.Software:The system's main software, aside from what (junk) runs on the DVR, is an ActiveX control that is compatible only with Internet Explorer. As long as your computer will support it (Windows-only), it works fairly well and allows you to view live video, playback recorded video, and configure most of the system settings though the web browser. The package also includes some apps for mobile devices. I only tried the Android app, which was a little sketchy to get running. Aside from figuring out how to install a raw .apk file onto your phone with no instructions, you have to configure several port and network settings both within the DVR and the app. These port settings do not share a common terminology between the DVR and the app, so it becomes an exercise in trial-and-error to get the app to connect. Once it does connect, live video can be viewed from an Android phone, albeit at reduced quality. There doesn't seem to be a way to playback recorded video or check motion events from the phone. Also the Android app seems to be ... stolen from some other security camera manufacturer. It contains branding and product names that seemingly have nothing to do with SVAT or this product. Regardless, it was able to connect and work.DVR unit:The DVR itself seems to be a computer running some flavor of Linux with the SVAT application loaded. The system boots fairly quickly and reliably after power failure. The hardware contains 8 BNC video input connectors, two composite video outputs (one is BNC style), one VGA video output, two USB ports for mouse and external storage, and some kind of digital I/O or trigger with screw terminals.The interface is fairly straight-forward if a little clunky. I found it much easier to just assign it an IP address and configure the rest through the web interface rather than grind through the menus and enter settings with the on-screen keyboard. The manual is terse and contains more information about configuring Internet Explorer and registering an account with DynDNS than this product (Also, DynDNS is apparently no longer free to use, as implied by the manual).Now my gripe, and the reason for my below average review: neither the remote control nor any of the buttons on the front of the unit will work reliably if you use this product with a monitor connected to the VGA port. After numerous calls to SVAT support, I gathered that the unit expects your monitor to be connected to the composite output and the menus will only display on that output. There is a (undocumented) key combination of Function->Up Arrow->Enter that will supposedly allow the interface to work on the VGA monitor. Out of the 50 or so times I have entered this combination, it has worked only three times. When it works, the unit will beep and suddenly it becomes responsive -- until the next power cycle. 95% of the time that I have owned this product, the front buttons and remote have been completely useless and unresponsive. SVAT technical support acts as if this is by design and acceptable. I have called many times and explained that their secret key combination to enable the interface rarely works, and their only suggestion is to keep power cycling the unit and trying until it does work.Luckily I was able to get the unit network-enabled early on, so it is mostly usable through the web interface. However I view the complete unresponsiveness of the front-panel buttons and remote as a significant defect of the product, and apparently SVAT has no remedy -- caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: Good System - Good Value
Reviews.Author: Normal Guy
Reviews.Content: I purchased the CV301-8CH after doing research on various home security products and finding good reviews for SVAT solutions.  I didn't need eight cameras as offered with some of the other solutions, but I did want 8 channels on the DVR for future expandability.  The CV801-8CH package was a good fit at a reasonable price.  The package arrived promptly and was exactly as advertised (no surprises).  I was able to set it up and check it out with cameras just sitting on the floor in about 30 minutes.  One minor frustration is that the documentation leaves a bit to be desired in terms of usability.  There is a hardcopy quick start guide and a mini-CD with a full manual in PDF form.  I am very comfortable working with new systems but there wasn't a good overview of how everything hooked together from camera connection, to set up, to reviewing video.  It was easy enough to figure out the basics when it came to setting things up via the DVR menu, but it would have been nice to have a good overview and some specific examples of what could be done.  The only significant issues I ran into revolved around network access.  First, the online interface does work with 64 bit Windows systems - that would have been nice to know up front. I also had challenges getting remote access working but the technical support folks were very helpful and the issues were resolved in less than an hour on the phone.  Be advised that if you want to access the system from a mobile phone you will likely need to download a free app.  I used a package called ASEE.  There are versions of the app for Androids and iPhones.  Once everything was set up, accessing the system from my phone is easy and pretty cool.My single biggest frustration with the system is working with the DVR software.  Based on what I have seen so far, you can only configure and manage the system from the DVR.  The network accessible functionality only provides access for camera viewing.  It would be nice to be able to configure and manage the DVR from a computer on the same network but it doesn't look like that is an option.  Configuring and managing the DVR requires using a locally attached monitor and a mouse.  This forces placement of the DVR in a location that is easily accessible which is somewhat contrary to an effective security system.  In addition, there is no keyboard option so the mouse has to be used for entering keyboard strokes.The quality of the camera pictures seems okay but I won't know for sure until I get the cameras installed in their actual locations.  Which leads to another observation: camera installations where the cables have to go through a wall (i.e. on the outside of a house) require a BIG hole because of the two connectors on the end of the cable.  In my case I ended up with a 3/4" hole in the wall.  Overall I am satisfied with this system so far.  I can't offer up a conclusive opinion right now because it's going to take some time to get the DVR installed in an appropriate location and get the cameras set up.

Reviews.Title: SVAT CV301-8ch review
Reviews.Author: Halo Dude
Reviews.Content: There are 2 reasons for a 2 star rating. The instructions for setting up your smart phone to view the cameras over the internet is vague and took a lot of time figuring it out. Also, the email feature doesn't work at all. I worked on that a long while and finally gave up. I called customer support and the guy just chuckled and said it just doesn't work and was sorry. This is one of the main reasons I bought this unit.I wrote the company and left a message for the customer support supervisor. If I get satisfaction I will redo this rating.The instructions for setting up your iphone, blackberry etc should include that you MUST change your ip address on your computer to anything other than the starting number 192.  Most home ip's start with 192.  You just go into your router and change it.  It took a while for me to find how to do this and turns out it's a simple process.

Reviews.Title: Get  something else with better cameras
Reviews.Author: A. Lewis "OBNXS1"
Reviews.Content: DVR seems to be OK but honestly the cameras that come with this one are pretty crappy unless you're using them for and interior space. Even then if it has any size to it they're iffy. Outside, they're pretty much unusable. IR spotlight about 10-15 feet out and everything is so grainy it's unrecognizable. I ended up replacing all the cameras with VideoSecu CCTV Home Video Outdoor CCD Bullet Security Camera Day Night 24 IR Infrared LEDs with Free Power Supply 1CJ which are AMAZING for the price. Getting system up and running to view on my iPhone was way more trouble than it should have been and I'm still waiting to hear back on why I can only access four cameras at a time. All in all, I probably would just buy a standalone DVR and hand pick my cameras for it next time.

Reviews.Title: Excellent system
Reviews.Author: J. hurley
Reviews.Content: This system is great , but if you are not a IT person you may find it a little confusing at first . The hard part was setting up  the iphone to work with the DVD after a call back from the tech support it was easy. As the other gentlemen said you must change your IP to static and change the last number of the IP address in the router to a number out side of the range that the computer assigns. Make sure you foward the port for the mobile device along with the gaming port and external mobile port number , use the mobile port number assigned by the DVR . The ststic IP address will never change even if you swap out the unit as i did to another SVAT system . The firm ware is very important to use the iphone to view web cams . The free program Asee+ is available from itoons and you can download it to you phone from the app store . this is the best and only program that will work on the iphoneipod and ipad2 i have all three and they work perfect with this applications. Make sure you have the latest firmware updated on the DVR and all is good.

Reviews.Title: Need to work on customer service!

Reviews.Content: I bought this product because of the good rating it received. It was very east to install, but it was very hard to put on my computer and I phone. I called for days and could not get in contact with anyone. Overall this is a good product, but customer service needs to be there for the customer at start up!

Reviews.Title: Great Cameras

Reviews.Content: So I got this for my small business. I figured I would try this before paying the alarm company a few thousand to do. I am so glad I did this first. It was a pain to run all of the wiring on the medal building, but once everything was setup the cameras are amazing. At night it looks like day even in the darkest of areas. I don't know how well it will work against fog though. However I am exteremly satisfied, and fully trust this to protect my business.

Reviews.Title: CV301-8CH-002 Camera and DVR
Reviews.Author: Not a tech person
Reviews.Content: Ordered this system because of the 8 channel DVR. Only needed 4 cameras but liked the idea of expandability. Spent an hour or so doing the programming, the included instructions were not real indepth but online instructions worked well. Was able to geteverything hooked up and viewing cameras. Did have to call customer support for assistance with Android phone viewing, butthey were able to assist me right away ( on a Sunday) and had the Android phone app working within 10 minutes. Camera quality is good, night vision is fair. Would not be able to distinguish features if needed. Overall good system for the money. Would purchase again.

Reviews.Author: R. Villano "corywashere"
Reviews.Content: Update.  Quality is marginal especially with contrast.  interface with os, mac or pc is weak.  Keep looking for a better product or a HUGE upgrade for this.I purchased these cameras a few months ago and took some time to get them up and running.  I havent had a lot of time to tie them into my computer network and cell phone but those are some of the main reasons that I bought this set up.  Also it is supposed to be the same as another brand that is much more. What I have done is set up half of the cameras to the hard drive with an external monitor.  SO EASY. Reviews.Title: Great system!
Reviews.Author: Be A. Wierdsma
Reviews.Content: I have this system installed for a few days now and so far its performance has been stellar. You definitely need to have some IT knowledge in order to install the system however, when we ran into a few snafus, we called the support line and their service was impeccable. The Svat rep did not only gave us the answers we were looking for but even hooked up with us, via our computer, and installed components for us after she locked in. She had us up and running very quickly. The camera quality needs some tweaking in the settings, the night vision is outstanding! I also monitor the system on my Iphone and Ipad.  I recommend to down-load the (free) MEye application rather than the suggested application.  It has worked flawless so far also.  So far so good!

Reviews.Title: Great product for a great price
Reviews.Author: Sergio
Reviews.Content: Just got this a few days ago, shipping was super fast and everything works just perfect. I didn't expect picture quality to be super hd, but its very fair for the money you getting everything for. Definetly would recommend for someone that doesn't want to spend thousand of dollars for surveillance system

Reviews.Title: It does the job but has some major limitations and quirks
Reviews.Author: Macdaddy
Reviews.Content: I bought this system to protect the house from a neighbor who was damaging our property.  It worked...mostly.  In one event, a camera stopped recording motion-based activity for a single 5-minute window that would have caught the neighbor stealing a piece of property from our yard.  That ironic timing doesn't help me like this product any better.  But in the remainder of the events of her efforts to steal or damage our property and home, it was caught on camera and helped us greatly with the police and the courts.Some things to consider:- These cameras are designed for very close range use, such as a covered porch or an entryway.  We are using them to watch the property line.  That means having a camera watch an outdoor line of upwards of 75 feet.  These cameras weren't designed for that.- The camera quality works great to prove nefarious activity occurred but you'll have difficulty identifying an unknown person at anything farther than 5 feet.  But if you know who the perpetrator is or if they are uniquely identifiable, then you can use them for longer range purpose.- The quality of the contrast control is pretty poor.  If you have a heavily shaded/sunny mixed area with a low-mounted view, the image washes out very badly, rendering things virtually useless.- Mounting and connecting is a breeze.- The mounting pedestals have a slightly weak grip and could slip a little.  You need to be careful to not over tighten it to compensate (in order to hold the camera steady).My experience:- I had to send multiple cameras back twice during the 1-year warranty to have them refocused.  I can't say the results have been all that great but it will have to do.- I had to set the DVR to reboot every night in order to make sure certain camera feeds continued to record motion.  Otherwise, some of them would simply stop recording on their own.- The DVR menus are pretty easy to navigate but watching recorded video is MUCH easier from the computer desktop software provided.- Because the DVR had to be installed in an upstairs spare bedroom far from the home internet router, I bought a wireless repeater and am able to stream the video from there to the router.  That lets me watch the video on my desktop, laptop and phone.  This is a HUGE peace of mind while away for extended periods (vacation, road trips, etc.).- The night view with the IR LEDs works pretty well.  When there is snow on the ground, the cameras see as far as they do in daylight.  But there is inconsistent "ghosting" of the lens that I can't answer for.  On some nights, the night view is good.  Other nights, it's as if there is a fog in the air.  Not every camera does it; and those that do it don't do it consistently.Conclusion:While this is by no means an awesome system, it has performed the task needed at the minimum acceptable levels.  For the price, I'm okay with that.  But next time I have to purchase a home security video system, I'm willing to pay more (much more) for higher level of quality and capability.  In the end, I'm glad I spent the money on this unit because it busted our neighbor and sent a clear message of protection.  We're glad to have it, even with its shortcomings and quality issues.

Reviews.Title: returned the product - unusable
Reviews.Author: concerned buyer
Reviews.Content: This was a present for me and I did not choose it, however, in the spirit of Christmas I went ahead and installed the product.  My request was for a high definition camera set (they have since removed that line from their marketing).  Note that 2 of the 8 cameras did not work out of the box and 1 cable did not work out of the box.  Also, I needed a 100' run to the front of the house and my wife purchased the cables that were recommended by Amazon - they did not work.  I then ordered 2 other ones from Amazon - they did not work either.  So there is a very low tolerance for interference with this product.So I had the cameras up and running and set them outside to get an idea of how they would look.  To say the least I was very angry that someone would even sell this.  There is no color (at best a smudge of purple where the green trees are).  The resolution is so low as to look like a cartoon.  I could not make out my kids 10 feet from the camera.  The night vision is a combination of black and white splotches.  This is useless for security as you cannot recognize anything, at best you can tell that someone broke into your house.  The resolution is much worse than the 400TVL videos on youtube.Then I tried to call support - bad idea.  They did not pick up and I was stuck in phone limbo.  They I sent an email and they responded 3 days later with a form email on how to troubleshoot the cameras.  Gee thanks.Save your time and money and look for something else - the reason they are discounting it so much is that there are so many unhappy customers.  People are trying to sell it used as they do not accept the returns...

Reviews.Title: cameras
Reviews.Author: tikitu2
Reviews.Content: Good cameras excellent night vision. Only down fall can't zoom in very well. Love that I can see it on my phone..android

Reviews.Title: For the Money? Great Buy! vs my older pricey system
Reviews.Author: Static
Reviews.Content: Bought the Svat 301 from eslewhere, cheapest price I found.i had an older 4 ch system from an good but expensive site, worked very strong for 4 1/2 yrs but one cam connection in back always cut in and out, not good when your 400 miles away! Bought the Svat for 500 bones! vs my 4Ch for $1,500.00 4 yrs ago.Love the new type of otions! remote control over all the funtions camera sensitivity, mask & users via internet, Apparantly the systems alarms wont work, but you'd get bombarded anyway, it was supposed to work w/ motion, not good.I eventually will use a smart phone to view as well. Note if you cant do a forward for setup online, then set it up as a staticunder internet options! save you 20 minutes on the helpful but long help phone line! Ha!Could be my system but seems a bit sluggish via net, BUT I'm using Sat' internet at the cam location, slow upload speed I'm sure will do that, but it works!I know what an expensive system and setup is like and this feels a tad cheaper, and not sure of it's longevity, BUT all cams worked on arrival!! unlike other reviews Ive read. My older 4 cams work fine on this system, 1 wirelessly 5 stars for now w/ the happiness of more cams, at a cheap price and kick butt options! Knowing what systems are like the clarity is not as bad as people say, if you want read license plates like in the movies pay the big bucks and get a tighter focal lens camera to bring you in to see plates if thats what you need, but the car will probably be stolen anyway! Ha!  Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: poor cameras
Reviews.Author: zoeyalby
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the svat 301 8 camera system. So far not too Impressed,5 of the 8 cameras are blurry. Thought that maybe its just an inferior system,but 3 cameras are pretty clear.All in all my old 4 camera system made by netrome blackbox is far more superior,especially in camera clearness.However they went out of business and cannot get cameras to add to it to make it an 8 camera system.I am currently sending back the 5 bad cameras for testing and they said they would replace them if they find them defective. In the meantime Im down a security system for 2 to 4 weeks and out the shipping costs unless they find them defective,as I understand I will be reimbursed. I guess we will see. I used to never buy anything online especially electronics because of this right here. It would be nice to just return this thing to the store. Unfortunately I waited three weeks to install this unit by time I got it completed my return to store warranty was up. Hopefully svat will take care of this problem so maybe I can write a better review.

Reviews.Content: I purchase this Surveillance set on 03-12-2013, it work great for five months after that it will change the date by it self , it will not record , also when you download recorded information on a memory stick ,it is impossible to review it.

Reviews.Title: great

Reviews.Title: Good system

Reviews.Content: This is easy to setup, If You use the very Helpful call in line. You will call a few times, but will get it and then it is easy and does a lot of things. Reviews.Title: Quality Security System

Reviews.Title: It will work

Reviews.Content: The system overall will work for what we needed.  My husband installed it himself and he didn't have any difficulty with the installation other than it took some time.  Overall, the system will fit our purpose.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera system.
